# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function called `wrap_string` which takes in a string and an optional integer parameter `text_width`. It iterates over the words of the input string, wrapping them at every `text_width` limit. The function returns an array of wrapped lines.
```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    wrapped_lines = []
    line = ""

    for word in words
        line *= word * " "
        
        if length(line) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(line)
        push!(wrapped_lines, line)
    end

    return wrapped_lines
end
```
Example:
```julia
text = "This is an example text that will be wrapped into lines with a specified width. It demonstrates how the wrap_string function works."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(join(wrapped_text, "\n"))
```
